0.text: Bug 32286  ControlExample Button Tab - changing styles resets button orientation.

1.text: Problem Description:  When using the Button controls from the SWT Controls example, if SWT.ARROW  buttons are used and SWT.BORDER property is selected or deselected, the arrow  alignment property of all the arrow buttons is reset to UP.

3.text: Ensure that Eclipse is not running.

10.text: Go to Window->Show View->Other and select SWT Controls under SWT Examples.

11.text: A  new SWT Controls view appears.

13.text: Expand the new view if neccesary, and click on the button tab.

15.text: On the right of the pane, select "SWT.ARROW" in the styles group.

16.text: The  buttons will change to arrow buttons, pointng up.

18.text: Select an alignment other than "up" from the alignment group.

19.text: The arrow  buttons will change their orientation.

21.text: Select or deselect SWT.BORDER in the styles group.

22.text: The arrows will change  their orientation back to "up".

24.text: Select a new orientation for the arrows.

26.text: Note that the arrows will again change their orientation to "up".

28.text: Eclipse: V2.1 Build Id: 200302061700 (M5), with M5 example  plugins.
